abstract: Avago Technologies to buy the LSI Corporation for about $6.6 billion in cash. | A.I.G. reaches a new deal to sell its aircraft leasing arm. | Investors warmed to Moncler, the luxury winter apparel maker. | The newest haven for offshore assets is the Cook Islands in the South Pacific.
snippet: Avago Technologies to buy the LSI Corporation for about $6.6 billion in cash. | A.I.G. reaches a new deal to sell its aircraft leasing arm. | Investors warmed to Moncler, the luxury winter apparel maker. | The newest haven for offshore assets is t...
lead_paragraph: Avago Technologies said on Monday that it had agreed to buy the LSI Corporation for about $6.6 billion in cash, moving into the world of networking and storage chips in a bet on the increased use of cloud and mobile software.

headline.main: A Bet on Cloud and Mobile Software

byline.original: By Chad Bray and Michael J. de la Merced
